comment: idk why she has a 3/5. Overall, it was not too bad. The only thing I didn't like at all was the grading criteria; she was really strict on that. Easy class, two mandatory concerts, and two outside activities that could be picked on YouTube and written about. I would take her if you want an easy A.

Professor Berry makes the course engaging with fun lectures. While the content can be dense, the weekly quizzes and discussions are straightforward. I found unstuck study helpful for preparing. Overall, an easy A class.

Professor Berry was a good professor! She gives you plenty of extra credit opportunities and allows you to participate in outside activities like watching dance concerts and engaging in dance activities. The only drawback is that she assigns plenty of work for it being an online course. There are weekly discussion posts, readings, and quizzes!

This was the worst professor I had this semester. When I emailed, she always gave a rude response and was never helpful. She does grade strictly and sometimes even unfairly.... For example, I received 5 points off (so a 75%) on a discussion post because my group member didn't post anything for me to respond to by the deadline. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Overall this class was great, she offered numerous opportunities for extra credit throughout the course. Work is available ahead of time if desired to do so early. There are two required concerts you must attend on the Marietta Campus and two outside activities that need to be done as well but you are reviewing a style of dance. Great class

Online Class. She goes week by week (lectured videos, discussions, a quiz). She is pretty easy but, if you are planning on taking her class online, She does require 2 concert attendances. You have to buy the tickets and attend them on the Marietta campus. Which I know was hard for people who live far away. She does offer extra credit ;)

Professor Berry is a great teacher that gives critical but helpful feedback. She uses every moment she can to teach her students. She practices tough love for all her students. Overall I love being in her classroom and her lectures are always interesting and informative.

Mrs. Natalie Berry is the best teacher that I have ever had. She gives great feedback and is a great teacher. Mrs. Natalie is strict but not super critical and she knows how to make a class fun but, while still being instructive.
She is very knowledgeable in dance. Her lectures were fun and understandable. Would definitely recommend to dance majors or people interested in the subject.
Stingy over giving an A for a discussion post like bro its my opinion

(Easy A). Weekly quizzes & discussion posts; content is gathered from weekly lectures. Lectures can and will be extremely content-heavy, but the quizzes and discussions are a no-brainer. Gave a lower score because I was on time with EVERY single assignment, until the last "major" paper. I had a documented excuse, and she still took off 20 points.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: She is very enthusiastic about dance. Work takes me about 30 min-1 hr. Weekly readings (not needed), lectures, and videos along with a quiz and discussion post. Quizzes are fairly easy and she gives you two attempts. There are 2 mandatory concerts and papers and 2 dance "classes" which can be done on YouTube. Fairly easy class and is an easy A

Weekly readings (which u dont need to do), lecture videos, discussion posts and quizzes. She loves what she does and there's about 30min - 1hr of work per week. Two required KSU dance concerts and two dance classes which can be youtube tutorials. Quizzes are lockdown but open note. She's super sweet! Take her! Super easy A.

She's a cool lady. I docked points because she's a tough grader and strict about times. The content is pretty interesting, but she can be longwinded in her lectures sometimes. Discussions are due at 5pm on Friday's and you have to go back and reply to one person by Sunday. Weekly quizzes.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: She offered over a letter grade of extra credit. Though the class was online we were still REQUIRED to participate in MULTIPLE outside activities (Dance concerts and classes). No textbook but many weekly readings along with lecture videos for discussions and quizzes. Two papers based on concerts and one final (previous quiz questions). Very EXTRA!
I enjoyed her. She was very clear with online lectures and the quizzes are based on them. Going to the dance concerts were eh, but to be honest the class was an easy A if you just do the work.

I don't understand the bad reviews. This was one of the easiest classes I've ever taken. The lectures and material can be long but you don't need to take notes. The quizzes have two attempts and only lockdown your browser. You can easily go back to the material and answer the questions again. Discussion posts are easy. Just take her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: She is a good teacher. This class is just a lot of work. It is a lot of lectures and a quiz and discussion post every week. She is very good at giving clear directions but it is NOT an easy A. There were many times when she wanted us to watch 45+ minute long videos and then quizzed on it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: She wasn't the worst professor. The class wasn't difficult as long as you watched her lectures. She has due dates at 5 pm on Fridays and Sundays. She's strict with her rubrics so make sure you read those carefully. The grade was based on weekly quizzes and discussions, 2 outside activities, 2 performances, and a final.

I was excited when i saw she had pretty good rating but am highly regretting taking her class. She grades discussion posts so hard. The 1st is always due at 5pm on a friday and the followup on sunday at 5. She is not caring tbh. Grades on a point based scale which makes it harder to know if you are doing good or not. I would stay away if you can.
Make sure you do every assignment the correct way and take good notes you will need them.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If you do the notes, and listen to the lectures you will get a great score on the weekly quizes. The quizes and the final are lockdown browers but no camera, notes can be used. I enjoyed the class but the lectures were very very long some weeks.

She gives readings from the library, not textbooks but gives only one a week that you take a quiz on. She really appreciates participation, and if you read and take good notes during class, you will easily pass the class. All exams are open notes. Also, be willing to participate in her practical dance lessons, it makes class that much more fun!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Berry made a couple of one-off comments during the semester that made us all feel uncomfortable. Each class is a lecture and there are only three tests the entire semester, so you have to be prepared to study when it comes time. She is very nice but is ignorant of the current social climate.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Class was all online. All materials were online. There were 2 required dance concerts. Highly recommended if you have to take this to round out your major.

She is one of the best teachers. I am not a dancer but she makes it very interesting as long as you GO TO CLASS and TAKE NOTES you should make an easy A all of the tests are open notes and she is such a nice teacher I would take her all the time if I could.

Professor Berry is an okay professor. She definitely wont be the best Professor youve had, but she wont be the worst either. She does require attendance at a few concerts that I though were boring. But, if you have a passion for dance shes pretty good

Professor Berry was a great professor. Class wasnt mandatory but she did give a lecture every class about making it on time. Lectures arent posted on D2L so if you miss the class dont expect to do well on the tests. All test info comes from notes. Shes very nice and understanding though I really enjoyed her class!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: She was cool. A lot of BORING videos, 4 discussions, and 2 test. You have 2 dance and a concert you have to write a paper on. There are readings that are required and questions about them will be on the test but I just googled them.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof. Berry is very kind and understanding. I took this class online and she was very passionate about her student's understanding of the material. Her lectures are very interesting I suggest taking her a few in-person classes that are required of online, they are extremely fun even if you arent a dance major.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Literally my favorite teacher at KSU. She made my first semester really memorable and Im beyond grateful I got to take her. Shes extremely nice and understanding if you talk to her. Her tests arent hard and you can use your notes if she thinks the class will need them. She wants everyone to pass and understand the history that shes teaching.

Professor has a tendency to rabbit trail off topic. This semester she made disparaging comments about the association between violence and video games. When confronted, she shut down debate. If you're majoring in anything gaming related I do not recommend her.
This professor would get an attitude when I asked for help on assignments. Shes one of the laziest professors Ive ever had.

She made this class more difficult than it should've been. She seems really nice and is helpful, but she can grade the discussion posts a little harsh. Also there a group projects and it sucks because it's hard to do those for an online class..

Natalie is suppose to be teaching Dance in society, but aside from some African and Asian cultural references built into the cirriculum don't expect to here about but anything but Ballet. She clearly holds western dance as the elite form and finds ways to interject it or compare it to every other culture we learn about.

This professor was so sweet and is willing to work with you if you ever have a question. Every week there were lectures online and at the end of the week, there was homework due. The tests weren't awful, but pay attention to the lectures and take notes. You have two concerts to attend with a small essay (mandatory), but they were cool to watch.

I loved having Professor Berry this semester. She made the class interesting, and all tests/quizzes are open note which is verbatim to her slides. She opens the class for discussions which allowed understand the information better and connect with my peers. Take good notes and be active in class, and it'll be an easy A! Take in person if you can!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Honestly my favorite teacher this semester. Shes big on not having phones out but her animated nature makes her lectures fun. You do dance sometimes but its fun.

LOTS OF WORK! its all super unnecessary. The group projects are a lot if your group sucks, but the discussion posts arent too bad. I hated that I had to go to 2 performances, and had to go take actual classes. The first week is overwhelming, but it does get easier. I would not take this class as you cultural appreciation course. Take theatre.

This is probably one of the worst professors I have. The class is not even suppose to be difficult but she makes it. If you do one thing wrong she fails you and you spend your money on performances. Since when are you supposed to spend money on a dance performance. She acts like everyone in the class is going to major in dance and is just awful.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Took this class online over the summer. She is a great teacher and cares about the class a lot. That being said, this class is no joke. There is a lot of work, multiple lectures to watch each week, and a dance concert to attend (which isn't too bad). You can easily get an A if you put in the work, but you will be busy with this class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Her class is easy but it is a lot of work, or at least for summer classes since it's constricted to 8 weeks. She makes you go to concerts and outside dance classes and write a paper on them which is not hard but some people can't dance and don't know where to go. 2 exams and the final. Lots of group projects. There's also quizzes. Take good notes

Professor Berry told the history of dance in such a fantastic way. This was one of my favorite classes ever. There are several group projects in the beginning, and that can often be a bad experience. Thankfully, my group was great, but that is something to consider.

If you're looking for an easy online fine arts class to pass don't take berry. She obviously thinks everyone who takes her class is majoring in dance rather than taking it as a gen ed. If you email her and ask questions she will become rude with you and basically ruin the rest of the semester for you. Don't recommend.

Professor Berry is really sweet and caring. I took this course online but it was very simple and straightforward. She held outside activities that were really fun to participate in. We had to attend three concerts, the tickets are $15. Overall the course was really fun and not difficult at all.

Berry is a really nice and caring professor. Her class is literally set up so you can not make below an A in her class. She gives a lot of extra credit opportunities in class and out of class. Tests are online and you are allowed to use notes. There should be no excuse to why you don't make an A in her class. Also a good class to have friends in.
a very sweet lady. give her youre attention and she will help you do good in the class. but dont underestimate how hard the dance class will be. shockingly harder than expected.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great class- fun teacher, great to be around. Made some friends and barely danced.

Class did little to no dancing and I never danced. Does extra credit. 7 five question quizzes, two 30 something question exams, midterm, final, 3 writing assignments, and a choreography workshop. Only 3 allowed unexcused absences and then final grade will be effected. She's very energetic for an 8AM. Show up and take notes and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Ms. Berry's personality and knowledge of dance made what could have potentially been a boring and mediocre class come to life. Tests come straight from notes (which we can use), she's really nice and you can tell she cares about dance and her students.
She is very nice and respected person. Easy Grade. You only dance few time but its fun even I can't dance or get in front people. Loved this class.

TAKE HER CLASS!!! Her lectures are amazing. She goes out of her way to make class enjoyable and funny while still covering the material. Her class opened my eyes to so many new perspectives, I would take it again a hundred times. 10 online quizzes throughout the semester and only 2 online exams plus the final. By far my favorite class and professor

I took professor Berry as an 8am and dreaded it. She's a nice lady, but kinda crazy. No phones, can only miss 3 classes, and you have to go to concerts for a grade. The only way I got through it was taking the class with 3 of my roommates. To be fair, dance in society is a boring class in general,  so if you know people in the class you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: For an 8 AM class, Professor Berry made it very enjoyable. Though the class is a gen ed, she makes it very easy to get an A. Attendance is mandatory, you can only miss 3 and then you drop a letter grade. Weekly quizzes and tests are all online so it is almost impossible to not get an A. Would take again.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is a very sweet professor. Encourages you to meet new people and learn about different cultures. Lots of extra credit, but somewhat hard tests and a lot of quizzes and reading. She takes roll every day and attendance is manadarory. You have to work for an A, but you learn a lot!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Natalie Berry is by far the strangest professor i have ever had (you'll see after a few classes what i mean). You are allowed 3 absences. After that your final grade suffers. However if you come in 45 mins late she still counts you as being there the whole time. Lots of quizzes, but tests and quizzes are all online so take detailed notes!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Such a sweet lady, she defiantly plays favorites and there is a ton of readings and notes. If you show up, take notes, and read the assignments and A is so easy. She is very helpful and everything is open note. The lectures can get really boring towards the end but sometimes you are let out early. Would recommend for fulfilling core classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Inspirational

comment: I wish I'd just done my art credit online. She doesn't make you buy a textbook, and does try to make the class easy- but kinda took it too seriously. She was sweet, but played favorites, and kinda penalized those who weren't her favorite. Exams/quizzes can get confusing but they're all online so you can take them open note. Attendance is a must too
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: 3 absences allowed, then letter grades off. No book but mandatory shows, (one in downtown ATL). Notes all through class, tests online are easy if you take good notes. Quizzes almost weekly, EASY! You will dance, and there is a choreography grade. Aggravating teacher and class, she takes the class too serious, but super easy A! Make a friend!!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Took this class because I thought it would be an easy A- WRONG! For a required credit, Prof. B takes it way to seriously. Even with word for word notes the tests are difficult. The paper for one of the shows is truly one of the hardest papers I've ever written & I am an English Educ. major. 3 absenses and then letter grade deductions. Can be snippy
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Every single day you will take notes from the beginning of class until the end so you need to go to class. Many online open note quizzes and tests that are very easy. She is sometimes rude to her students and a little bit insane. She also takes the class too seriously. If you put in effort you will make an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She knows this class is a core class and treats it as such. She is hilarious and the tests and quizzes are super super easy. I would love to take another class with her as the professor.

She runs the class as if it were a hybrid. Required online readings+quizzes on content not yet covered in class; quizzes often have trick/ deceitful questions. She's nice in class; lectures and long, but usually interesting. The reading quizzes are hard, but exams are easy+open note. REQUIRED (or your grade drops one letter) trip to Atlanta- $45.

I recommend this class, but I truthfully dreaded it. She's often very rude to her students and you have to take notes every single day until your hands hurt. It's not the hardest class, but if you aren't really into dance, it's very boring. She frustrated me, but it wasn't a hard class. I just wasn't a fan of her teaching style.

NO TEXTBOOK for this class. All her exams& quizzes are online and are open-note (got an A on every single assignment and test). DON'T SKIP bc her tests are word for word from the powerpoints and she does not post them online so you must go to class to get the notes. Quizzes are over long boring readings that are read on your own time.

Although Ms. Berry is very passionate about what she does, she does not interact with students well. She has been rude on several occasions when students asked a simple questions. She lectures for the entire class period every. single. day. Only upside is no textbook is required for this class. You will get an A if you take A LOT of notes.

She was such a sweet teacher! She does have a no cell phone policy during class, so make sure she doesn't catch you on it.  All her testsquizzes are online and very easy. You can use your notes for all of them. She usually ends classes early too, so your not always there the full time. She makes class a lot of fun!

As long as you show up and take the notes from her powerpoints you will pass. All of the quizzes and tests are online and she encourages you to use your notes on them. You must attend two concerts during the semester that are $15 each. She is usually nice but can often be very rude to students.

This class was a hybrid course, but it almost felt like she thought she could pile on the outside work because of this. I think most of my homework came from this class. She's pretty rude, but I could manage her for 1 day a week. Her tests are also very easy compared to how difficult the course is, which I guess is a bonus
This class was way to hard. She is awful with communication and working with the students. She seems as if she hates her job. Her tests were in class and stressful.

This class was a hybrid class, but gave double the amount of work for the online portion. She was awful with communication and was strict on how to email. She was rude but tried to act innocent about it. Most of my time was dedicated to this class, things were due one after another everyday. Tests were in class with trick questions. Very stressful!

Professor Berry tends to be rude and very strict. Extremely anti-electronics so don't bring your phone if you will be tempted. She will throw you out for checking the time on your phone. Class is pretty boring and there is not much dancing. All of the quizzes and tests are online so if you need a GPA booster it's an easy A.

She took this class way too seriously. I love dance which is why I took this class. BUT no electronics or she'll kick you out. She has a slight attitude and doesn't have much understanding for emergencies. Attendance is mandatory. She'll drop you a whole letter grade for each absence after your 3rd. Could be more pleasant.
Class is not too hard. Just show up and take good notes. Tests and quizzes are al online. She has an attitude problem though and she is really particular about rules. Lectures are extremely boring.
Natalie is such an awesome human being! Text is not required; she provides links for the short stories. There are a lot of quizzes, and notes. Notes are a must take!!! Mandatory is required.

I love dance so  i thought it would be interesting. i love the way natalie teaches and there are lots of videos in class.Note taking is a must but all tests and quizzes are online as well as the readings.(so easy btw). the only problem is that she has that dumb cell rule and that attendance sheet we have to sign a show minute after and you're late

Took class WAY too seriously, test&quizzes are all online, but IMPOSSIBLE! NEVER missed class, wrote notes WORD FOR WORD off ppt&tests were still that difficult. becomes too specific on test, but not while speaking on topic in class&then defends herself when make valid/good point that she wasn't clear. attempted to get points back, w/ no success.

She Is crazy! Way to serious about a class that doesn't matter for most people. Attendance is mandatory. Absolutely no electronics or she will kick you out. Class id hard and dumb for a class that should be an easy A. Take  at your own risk.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR AN EASY A. Like, everyone else has said, she takes her class way to seriously. attendance mandatory, note taking is a must to pass the test, just overall way too serious. she acts like it is your most important class. i was miserable sitting through her lectures.

Like previous reviews, her class has gotten harder. The tests in my opinion were pretty hard, but the class overall is not super hard.  I recommend doing extra credit and doing good on the quizzes. Not a super hard class, but also not nearly as easy as I thought it was going to be.  I recommend taking a different class such as music or theater!

Without a doubt one of the best teachers at KSU. Ignore the lazy chumps that felt her class was too hard- seriously- all open note tests and quizzes, doesnt get any easier than that. She is funny and engaging, very caring. Easy A, just keep up with assignments and youll do fine. FYI- this is college- you gotta do your work.

Just so you all know, Natalie's class has gotten harder since this last semester. She told us that she was required to make her tests harder and quiz questions harder. So the easiness ratings may not apply anymore. I know that this class wasn't as easy as I thought it would be, and I was never really absent.

Natalie takes her class WAY too seriously..she acts like this is our most important class. Although I went into the class thinking it would be fun, I now wish that I would have taken either theater or music. DO NOT take this class.
As long as you follow her rules, and come to class late you will enjoy the class. Its obvious how much she loves dance by the way she teaches.

all this class is is just notes after notes. you have to listen to everything she says and write it down, or you will lose major points on tests. i was absent ONE day, and without those notes, i failed a test. if you walk in a minute late she points you out in front of the whole class. take another professor to fulfill this requirement.  shes ridic

She is really easy. No textbook and all the tests and quizzes are online so open note. She does not post notes online so you have to write them all down. She keeps class pretty entertaining. Do not use your phone or computer because she will make you leave class.

She's sweet and is flexible with your grade as long as you talk to you her. No textbook, just online quizzes and tests. There is a mandatory attendance policy and she doesn't put her notes online. Overall, easy class to fill the requirement
Professor Berry is easily one of the rudest people that I have ever met. The class is super easy, but very boring.

She's very sweet, and tries to make class fun. She can be a bit rude if you walk in a minute past your class time....do NOT text or be on the computer, she'll call you out and tell you to leave. Other than that, it's an easy laid back class. Just follow her rules!

Natalie is the best! She's so cool. I had no interest in this class at all, just took it to fill a requirement. But she's my favorite professor I've ever had. Extremely nice and upbeat and funny. No textbook. Online tests/quizzes. You have to go to two performances. No final, just one final paper on a performance you have to attend. TAKE THIS CLASS

No textbook needed. Professor Berry is very sweet and interactive. She really does try to make class enjoyable.Unfortunately she got really sick and wasn't able to be our teacher for the full semester. I would def take her!

No textbook use, all tests and quizzes are online so you can use your notes, she is VERY flexible with any issues that arise. She's a teacher that WANTS everyone to get an A. She's just so nice and fun! She can get a bit crazy, but it keeps class interesting :) TAKE THIS CLASS FOR YOUR FINE ART! :D

Prof berry is an awesome person and professor who loves her job and will memorize all her students names! Attendance mandatory! No textbook, just online readings/quizzes/tests. Soo many extra credit opportunities that if you don't get an A, be concerned. Class can get boring esp. Because she doesn't allow ANY electronic devices, but easy A!

Prof. Berry loves her job and definitely hates when the class isnt as upbeat as her. She does take roll everyday and the lectures can be a drag if youre not into dance but if you complete your quizzes and take notes you'll do fine.
She  no longer posts the powerpoints online, but her class is still very easy! She is really sweet and keeps class interesting for sure!

Mrs. Berry is a really good professor. She is very friendly and extremely passionate about dance. Test questions come straight from her powerpoints and they are all posted online. She is very strict on attendance so I would always go to class. There are also several extra credit opportunities. I would definitely take this course again!

I love Mrs. Berry, she is so sweet and such a good teacher. She is very funny and tries to make class up beat and interesting. All of the tests and quizzes are online and all of the notes she shows in class are posted online and she gives you an an hour to complete the quiz and it is usually only 5 questions.

Not too sure why everyone is giving her a bad rating.  Easiest class on the planet.  Attendance is mandatory, but she keeps it decently interesting.  Tests and quizzes are all online, and she posts PowerPoint slides containing every piece of information you ever need to make a 100 on everything.  Not too sure what else you guys are looking for!

I enjoyed this professor very much. She kept me interested the whole semester! She has a lot of powerpoint slides, but she posts them online so all you have to do in class is listen and take any extra notes. Very enjoyable class and definitely not a "time killer" as everyone else has said.
Uh, are you in this class?  The assignments are not time consuming at all.  Please.  This is an easy A.

Berry is annoying, The requirements for the class are time consuming she acts as if her class is the only class you are taking...there are like 3-4 outside of class assignments that make no sense...total waste for general education class. I wish I would have taking art

There are a lot of power points, but they are posted online so it's not like u have to take tons of notes. Tests and quizzes are online. VERY strict on attendance and she does tend to favor dance students. She is very passionate with the way she teaches and i found it entertaining. Easy A if u attend class. NO BOOK!!!

I am currently taking the class and I cannot stand her. She thinks she's some prima-ballerina and she's not. She favors anyone who is a dance major, so if you're not a dancer or you are it's not your major don't expect any attention. As for the work it seems okay so far. Every test, quiz and reading is online except for lectures.

I did have to study but I thought the class was okay.  I liked the teachers because they told stories.  Yes, lots of slides but they post the power points on the class webpage.  I didn't take notes and still did well in this class.

DO NOT take this class!!! It is the worst class ever. If you want to keep HOOPE or get HOPE then this class will not help you. Notes are very long and your expected to already know things about Dance. Take a different atr history class

Terrible. Way to intense for a gen ed appreciation class and Im really interested in dance. LOTS of information. Long power points everyday and youre expected to know every tiny bit if it for midterm/final

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!! both teachers are completely ridiculous. one teacher patrols class while other teaches. they expect you to memorize way to much information and do not even give study guide. i make good grades and struggled in this class. take theatre, music, or art BUT NOT THIS CLASS!!!

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!! This was the first year they offered this class and I was so excited because I love dance! But both professors are disrespectful and expect way too much!! This is just dance 1107 but they act like if you're taking this class you want to major in dance!! Take Art, Theatre, or Music!! This class is awful!!!!

DO NOT I REPEAT DO NOT TAKE HER FOR DANCE! THIS CLASS IS RIDICULOUS ( I AM A GREAT STUDENT WITH A 3.5 ) THE TWO PROFS (BERRY AND PERRY) GAVE ME 50'S ON WORK! EVERYONE HATED THIS CLASS IT IS USELESS DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND TAKE THEATRE OR SOMETHING OTHER THAN THIS DANCE CLASS BECAUSE IT EQUALS DEATH!

this is the WORST class that I have ever taken. It is basically like you are in a dance major class. It 1107 it shouldnt be this hard.YOu have about 70 slides per class. Veery long lectures. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.
She will get on your last nerve! do not take this class take another form of the arts like theatre! TRUST ME! too much work for a dance class!
